td.p: Dear Students, Parents/Guardians and Community Members;
Just a quick update on a few things this week.

ul.li: We are asking all students to get any remaining personal items out of the school buildings. Both buildings will be open from 4-6 p.m. on Thursday, April 30. This will be their last chance to get items out of the building. Items left in the building after April 30 will be collected and disposed of.
School library books should be returned on April 30 or can be brought to grab-and-go lunch locations on Monday, April 27. Lunches are handed out from noon until 12:30 p.m.
Grab-and-go meals will continue through Monday, May 18. At this time we are waiting for further direction from the state as to whether this program will continue into the summer.

Prom has been tentatively rescheduled for Saturday, June 20. If crowd limitations or are still in place at that time and/or if the event cannot be conducted in a way that protects public safety, Prom will be canceled.
We are working with Seniors and their parents/guardians on a plan for Commencement. When details are known they will be released.

Our continuous learning plan will continue through May 15. Please encourage your children to communicate with their teachers and participate in continuous learning to the maximum extent possible as we want all students to be as prepared for their next level of learning as possible.

td.p: We hope everyone is remaining healthy and safe. Please continue to do all you can to social distance and flatten the curve so we can get back to some sort of normal sooner rather than later. We are all in this together.
Mr. Miller Mr. Wall Ms. Whitson

a.aria-label: Read more about COVID-19 UPDATE

div.p: Hello IKM-Manning Parents/Guardians, and Students:

Even though the IKM-Manning Community School District doors are closed, our school’s heart is still going. While academics are very important for our students, we don’t want this to become added stress for you and your family. There is no greater time for all of us to extend care, grace and understanding towards each other. We WILL get through this together. Based on the current Iowa Department of Education (IDOE) Guidance on what districts can and can not do, our district will continue to provide K-12th grade Voluntary Educational Enrichment Opportunities. This means the learning options are available but not mandatory for students to participate. Per the Iowa Department of Education, this option will count as instruction and no days will need to be made up.

We want to emphasize how important our continuous learning plan is for our families and students to engage in their learning as we know it is voluntary, but for example; if your child is enrolled in a course that builds skills necessary for the success of another course, such as Algebra I and Algebra II, and your child is planning to take more rigorous math courses beyond those required, doing nothing during this time of voluntary learning could put your child at a serious disadvantage when school resumes later this spring or in the fall. This would be the same scenario for any middle school students as well as elementary. If you miss a full quarter of second grade when you come back in the fall in third grade and you have not participated in this learning opportunity you could fall behind grade-level expectations.

Continue to look for communications from the school and your child’s teachers in the upcoming days with more information about continuous learning. New information will come out each Sunday evening once this system is fully in place.

Supplementary National and State Resources: The Iowa Department of Education has put together a depository of resources for parents to aid in supporting their children at home. You can access via this link. https://educateiowa.gov/pk-12/resources-support-learning-during-covid-19

Wi-Fi: At this time wi-fi has been turned on at each school. Students and parents/guardians can access the school’s Chromebook and Guest networks from your car by parking close to the building. We are just asking that people and students maintain good social distance when working in the parking lot.. Many cell phone companies have added, at no cost, additional data to your plan. You may want to check with your provider.

Teacher Phone Calls: It is possible a teacher may call to talk to you or your child and the number may appear as blocked, or private. Please answer these calls as teachers won’t be calling from a school district number since all are working from home.

ACT Preparation: This would be a fantastic time for students to prepare for ACT tests if they are planning to take the test in the next year. ACT. org has many free resources. The Iowa High School Association has a greatly discounted site available to all Iowa students. We will send this information to you as soon as we get the updated information.

Grab and Go Lunch Program Continues: This will continue at IKM-Manning (Manning, Irwin, and Manilla): each Monday from 12:00-12:30. I want to thank the volunteers and cooks who have made this successful every week. Monday we served over 415 students meals.

Positive and Uplifting News: We are posting many positive and uplifting updates on Twitter @ikmmhs and on our official Facebook page @IKM-Manning Schools If you would like to share something that you and your child/children are doing to continue learning, please send to Trevor Miller ( tmiller@ikm-manning.k12.ia.us ) and he will share it with the IKM-Manning District!

Essential Staff Only: Only essential staff are working in our buildings. Our hours are limited and may be reduced further, depending upon how this situation unfolds. The best method to get in contact with people is to send an email. Most IKM-Manning employee emails are (first initial, last name @ikm-manning..k12.ia.us) such as (tmiller@IKM-manning.k12.ia.us )

With schools' doors closed, our goal is to support all learners as best we can. We understand there are challenges and we appreciate the opportunity to work thoughtfully together. If you are struggling or need help, do not hesitate to reach out. Thank you again for your support, grace and understanding. We appreciate all the positive feedback. We are proud to be a part of the IKM-Manning School District, EVERYONE is pitching in and working hard to support every student at IKM-Manning under these most unusual circumstances.
Do not hesitate to reach out if you need help.
We are Here to Help You. If You Have Question Here is Where You Should Start:
● Technology support contact: Luann Langel (llangel@ikm-manning.k12.ia.us)
● Instructional questions: contact your child’s teacher
● Process or support questions: contact your child’s building administrator
● COVID-19 school-related questions, visit our website
● If you have further questions contact the Administration Office (712) 655-3781 or email Mr. Miller (tmiller@IKM-manning.k12.ia.us)
Take Care
Mr. Miller, Mr. Wall, Ms. Whitson

a.aria-label: Read more about Continuous Learning Plan

div.p:
Anyone living within the IKM-Manning School District is welcome to reach out to the Manning Food Pantry for an emergency visit if
needed. During the visit, you would be required to fill out a basic intake form to see if you are eligible for additional services
through New Opportunities, per the necessary program guidelines. Pastor Riggert has agreed to be the main contact for those
needing immediate assistance in this area. He can be reached at 515.570.3137.

a.aria-label: Read more about Food Pantry Information
